intro: Eccoilopus andropogonoides, commonly known as the purpletop grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and distinctive purple-tinted flower spikes. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Its inflorescence consists of dense, cylindrical clusters of small, two-lipped flowers. Eccoilopus andropogonoides plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in native plant restoration projects.
